div.l: And fonde the bedde and thought nat but good
By cause that the cradel by it stood
And ne wyste wher͗e she was for it was derke
But faire and weel she crepeth in to the Clerk
And lythe full stille and wold a caught a slepe
With in a while this Iohn the Clerk vp lepe
And on this good wyfe he leith on sore
So mery a fitte had she nat full yore
He prikketh hard and depe as he were madde
This lyf iolily haue these twoo clerkes hadde
Till þat the thridde Cok by gan to syngge
Aleyn wex worth worth wery in the dawnyngge
For he had swonken all that long nyght
And seid fare weel Malyn̄ swete wight
The day is comen̄ I may no lenger abyde
But eủere more wherso I go er ryde
I am thyne owen̄ Clerk so haue I hele
Now der͗e lēmman̄ qᵈuod she go fare wele
But er thou go one thyng I wole the telle
Whan that thou wendest homward by the mylle
Right at the entre of the door be hynde
Thow shal a cake of half a busshel fynde
That was y maked of thyne owen̄ mele
Whiche þat I helped my syre for to stele
And good lēmman̄ god thee saue and kepe
And wᵗith þat woord al moste he gan to wepe
Aleyn vp a ryste and thout er that it dawe
I wole go crepen̄ in by my Felowe
And fonde the cradel with his honde a none
By god thought he all wrong I haue mys gone
Myne hed is toty of my swynk to nyght
That maketh me that I go nat a right
I wote weel by the cradel I haue mys goo
Here lyth the myller and hise wyfe also
And forth he goth on twenty deuel wey
Vn to the bedde ther͗e as the myller ley
He wende haue cropen by his felowe Iohn
And by the myller he crope a non̄
And caught hym by the nekke and soft he spake
He seid thou Iohn thow swynes hed a wake
For crystes soule and here a noble game
For by that lord þat called is seynt Iame
As I haue thryes in this short nyght
Swyfed þe myllers douter bolt vp right
Whil thou hast as a Coward ben̄ agaste
Ya fals harlot qᵈuod the myller in haste
A Fals traytoᵘur fals Clerk qᵈuod he
Thow shal be ded by goddes dignite
Who durst be so bolde to desꝑparage
My douter that is comen̄ of suche lynage
And by the throte bolle he caught Aleyn̄
And he hente hym despitously a geyn̄
And on the nose he smote hym wᵗith his fyste
Doun̄ ranne the blody streme vp on his breste
And in the floor with nose and mouthe y broke
They walwed as doth the pygges in a poke
And vp they gon̄ and doun̄ a geyn a none
Till þat the myller sporned at a stone
And doun̄ he fel bakward vp on his wyfe
That wost no thyng of this nyce stryfe
For she s s was falle a slepe a litel wight
With Iohn the Clerk þat waked all nyght
And with þe fall out of hir sleepe she brayde
Helpe holy crosse of Bromholme she seyde
In manus tuas lord to the I calle
A wake Symond the fende is on me falle
Myne herte is broken̄ I ne am but dede
Ther͗e lyth oon vpon my wombe and vpon myn hede
Helpe Symkyn for the fals Clerkes fight
This Iohn sterte vp as faste as eủere he myght
And grasped by the walles to and froo
To fynden a staf and she sterte vp also
And knewe the esterys better þan dede that Iohn
And y the wall a staf she fonde a non
And saw a litel shymeryng of light
For at an hole in shone the mone light bryghtlightbryght
And by that light she saw hem bothe twoo
But sikerly she ne wyste who is whoo
But as she saw a white thyng by hir eye
And whan she gan this white thyng aspye
She wende the Clerk had wered a volyper
And with the staf she drough ay neer and neer
And wente an hitte this Aleyn at the fulle
And smote the myller on the pylled sculle
That doun̄ he goth and cryed harrowe I deye
These clerkes bete hym weel and lete hym lye
And grathen̄ hem and toke her hors a none
And eke her͗e mele and on her weye they gone
